intro: Metrosideros nigroviridis, commonly known as the black-veined flame tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. The leaves are typically dark green with prominent black veins, giving the plant its common name. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and unique foliage.
